Use Operations.GetOperation to poll the operation status and determine if cancellation succeeded. On successful cancellation, the operation record persists with an Operation.error value containing a google.rpc.Status.code of `1` (Code.CANCELLED). If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `google.rpc.Code.UNIMPLEMENTED`. Returns an empty response.

Returns the Hold object containing the hold's scope (accounts or organizational unit), query parameters, creation date, and other metadata. The authenticated user must have access to the matter.
data.reasoning: Original description is too minimal. Enhanced with parameter requirements, return value details (Hold schema properties), and access requirements for better AI agent understanding of what data is returned.

Description has good detail about constraints but lacks clarity on input/output and privilege requirements. Added information about request/response schemas, parameter requirements, and required privileges for AI agents to properly use this operation.

data.current_description: Updates the scope (organizational unit or accounts) and query parameters of a hold. You cannot add accounts to a hold that covers an organizational unit, nor can you add organizational units to a hold that covers individual accounts. If you try, the unsupported values are ignored.
data.summary_suggestion: Update hold scope and query parameters
data.description_suggestion: Updates the scope (organizational unit or accounts) and query parameters of an existing hold. Accepts a Hold object with updated values. Cannot change hold type (organizational unit to accounts or vice versa) - unsupported scope changes are silently ignored. Requires matterId and holdId parameters. Returns the updated Hold object. The authenticated user must have the Edit Holds privilege and access to the matter.
data.reasoning: Description has good detail about constraints but lacks clarity on input/output and privilege requirements. Added information about request/response schemas, parameter requirements, and required privileges for AI agents to properly use this operation.

data.current_description: Starts asynchronous cancellation on a long-running operation. The server makes a best effort to cancel the operation, but success is not guaranteed. If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `google.rpc.Code.UNIMPLEMENTED`. Clients can use Operations.GetOperation or other methods to check whether the cancellation succeeded or whether the operation completed despite cancellation. On successful cancellation, the operation is not deleted; instead, it becomes an operation with an Operation.error value with a google.rpc.Status.code of `1`, corresponding to `Code.CANCELLED`.
data.summary_suggestion: Request cancellation of a long-running operation
data.description_suggestion: Initiates asynchronous cancellation of a long-running operation. The server makes a best effort to cancel the operation, but success is not guaranteed - the operation may complete before cancellation takes effect. Use Operations.GetOperation to poll the operation status and determine if cancellation succeeded. On successful cancellation, the operation record persists with an Operation.error value containing a google.rpc.Status.code of `1` (Code.CANCELLED). If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `google.rpc.Code.UNIMPLEMENTED`. Returns an empty response.

message: Operation 'vault.matters.update' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details. Missing summary. Description could be clearer about which fields are updatable and privilege requirements. Added explicit privilege context for AI agent authorization checks.

data.current_description: Updates the specified matter. This updates only the name and description of the matter, identified by matter ID. Changes to any other fields are ignored. Returns the default view of the matter.
data.summary_suggestion: Update matter name and description
data.description_suggestion: Updates the name and description of the specified matter. Only these two fields can be modified; changes to other fields are ignored. Requires matter ownership or appropriate Vault privileges. Returns the updated Matter object with default view.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description could be clearer about which fields are updatable and privilege requirements. Added explicit privilege context for AI agent authorization checks.

data.current_description: Starts asynchronous cancellation on a long-running operation. The server makes a best effort to cancel the operation, but success is not guaranteed. If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `google.rpc.Code.UNIMPLEMENTED`. Clients can use Operations.GetOperation or other methods to check whether the cancellation succeeded or whether the operation completed despite cancellation. On successful cancellation, the operation is not deleted; instead, it becomes an operation with an Operation.error value with a google.rpc.Status.code of `1`, corresponding to `Code.CANCELLED`.
data.summary_suggestion: Request cancellation of a long-running operation
data.description_suggestion: Initiates asynchronous cancellation of a long-running operation. The server makes a best effort to cancel the operation, but success is not guaranteed - the operation may complete before cancellation takes effect. Use Operations.GetOperation to poll the operation status and determine if cancellation succeeded. On successful cancellation, the operation record persists with an Operation.error value containing a google.rpc.Status.code of `1` (Code.CANCELLED). If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `google.rpc.Code.UNIMPLEMENTED`. Returns an empty response.
